metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup

properties.description: 42Crunch API Protection data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: API Protection
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: Connects the 42Crunch API protection to Azure Log Analytics via the REST API interface

sampleQueries.query:
apifirewall_log_1_CL
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(30d)
| where Status_d == 429

sampleQueries.description: API requests generating a server error
sampleQueries.query:
apifirewall_log_1_CL
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(30d)
| where Status_d >= 500 and Status_d <= 599

apifirewall_log_1_CL
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(30d)
| where Error_Message_s contains "missing [\"x-access-token\"]"

dataTypes.name: apifirewall_log_1_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
apifirewall_log_1_CL
 | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
 | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
apifirewall_log_1_CL
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
 | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(7d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description: The installation process is documented in great detail in the GitHub repository [Microsoft Sentinel integration](https://github.com/42Crunch/azure-sentinel-integration). The user should consult this repository further to understand installation and debug of the integration.
instructionSteps.title: Step 1 : Read the detailed documentation

instructionSteps.description:
The first installation step is to retrieve both your **Workspace ID** and **Primary Key** from the Microsoft Sentinel platform.
Copy the values shown below and save them for configuration of the API log forwarder integration.
instructionSteps.title: Step 2: Retrieve the workspace access credentials

instructionSteps.description: The next step is to install the 42Crunch protection and log forwarder to protect your API. Both components are availabe as containers from the [42Crunch repository](https://hub.docker.com/u/42crunch). The exact installation will depend on your environment, consult the [42Crunch protection documentation](https://docs.42crunch.com/latest/content/concepts/api_firewall_deployment_architecture.htm) for full details. Two common installation scenarios are described below:

innerSteps.title: Installation via Docker Compose
innerSteps.description: The solution can be installed using a [Docker compose file](https://github.com/42Crunch/azure-sentinel-integration/blob/main/sample-deployment/docker-compose.yml).

innerSteps.title: Installation via Helm charts
innerSteps.description: The solution can be installed using a [Helm chart](https://github.com/42Crunch/azure-sentinel-integration/tree/main/helm/sentinel).

instructionSteps.title: Step 3: Install the 42Crunch protection and log forwarder

instructionSteps.description: In order to test the data ingestion the user should deploy the sample *httpbin* application alongside the 42Crunch protection and log forwarder [described in detail here](https://github.com/42Crunch/azure-sentinel-integration/tree/main/sample-deployment).

innerSteps.title: 4.1 Install the sample
innerSteps.description: The sample application can be installed locally using a [Docker compose file](https://github.com/42Crunch/azure-sentinel-integration/blob/main/sample-deployment/docker-compose.yml) which will install the httpbin API server, the 42Crunch API protection and the Microsoft Sentinel log forwarder. Set the environment variables as required using the values copied from step 2.

innerSteps.title: 4.2 Run the sample
innerSteps.description: Verfify the API protection is connected to the 42Crunch platform, and then exercise the API locally on the *localhost* at port 8080 using Postman, curl, or similar. You should see a mixture of passing and failing API calls.

innerSteps.title: 4.3 Verify the data ingestion on Log Analytics
innerSteps.description: After approximately 20 minutes access the Log Analytics workspace on your Microsoft Sentinel installation, and locate the *Custom Logs* section verify that a *apifirewall_log_1_CL* table exists. Use the sample queries to examine the data.

instructionSteps.title: Step 4: Test the data ingestion

connectorUiConfig.title: API Protection
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: Connects the 42Crunch API protection to Azure Log Analytics via the REST API interface

properties.description: @{workbookKey=42CrunchAPIProtectionWorkbook; logoFileName=42CrunchLogo.svg; description=Monitor and protect APIs using the 42Crunch API microfirewall; dataTypesDependencies=System.Object[]; dataConnectorsDependencies=System.Object[]; previewImagesFileNames=System.Object[]; version=1.0.0; title=42Crunch API Protection Workbook; templateRelativePath=42CrunchAPIProtectionWorkbook.json; subtitle=; provider=42Crunch}.description

APIAnomalyDetection_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0

42Crunch API protection against invalid host access
properties.query:
apifirewall_log_1_CL 
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(5m) 
| where Error_Step_s has "hostpath_mapping" 
| project-away Non_blocking_mode_b, Source_Port_d, Destination_Port_d, Query_s, API_ID_g, Response_Header_s, Request_Header_s, Errors_s, Type, UUID_g 
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

properties.description: APIJWTValidation_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0

properties.query:
apifirewall_log_1_CL 
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(5m) 
| where Error_Message_s has "missing [\"x-access-token\"]" 
| project-away Non_blocking_mode_b, Source_Port_d, Destination_Port_d, Query_s, API_ID_g, Response_Header_s, Request_Header_s, Errors_s, Type, UUID_g 
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

• Review the solution Release Notes

• There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The 42Crunch API Protection solution protects APIs by installing a microfirewall inline with the API server. Access logs from the microfirewall are emitted to Microsoft Sentinel allowing analysis and investigation of attacks.

Data Connectors: 1, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 11

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
